CommonsFunction: ^"You probably already came through here to get to our room."
^] "Anyway, this is sort of a big hub area."
^"The front desk is nearby, so if you need anything there or are expecting any packages, that's where you go."
^"The Commons is also obviously a big social area."
^Which is why I tend to avoid it...
^The only other person in sight is...

b: ^It doesn't look like Max has found them yet.
^But I know where they are. Should I...

FindersKeepers: ^I sneak away from Timothy for a brief moment to the couch Max had mentioned losing the keys in.
^I fish the keys out of the couch cushion. I remove the spare copy for my room from the ring and slip it into my pocket. Finders keepers.
^I stuff the remaining keys back where I found them and casually walk back to Timothy.
^He seems to be preoccupied watching Max.

g-0: ^"If I'm having a bad day, I sometimes come here. Social interaction helps with my uh... depression, but it can be kinda stressful."
^"I dunno exactly what your needs are, but the Commons are a good place to go if you want to be around people."
^Timothy has frozen where I had last looked and is shaking slightly.
^The poor guy looks like a kid caught stealing cookies from the cookie jar.
^"<jitter>I-I'm sorry I insulted Max and mis-gendered th-them!</jitter>"
^"You said you're sorry and you didn't mean to be disrespectful or anything. It's no harm, no foul dude."
^Honestly, what kind of life did this kid have where he thinks people would get mad over something like that?
^I mean, yeah, some people would get mad if he refused to correct himself or made a big deal out of it or something.
^But Max is the most chill person I know. They've tolerated much worse crap than that.

b: ^As for me? I'm usually too apathetic to care about slight mishaps like that.
^Again, assuming they're not being a jerk about it.
^Man, I am going to have to walk on egg shells around this kid, aren't I?
^Man, if he's having a freak-out over this, it's no wonder he breaks down by the end of the week.

g-0: ^I give Timothy a minute to collect himself before continuing the tour.

Awkward: ^Leaving that awkward conversation behind us, it's time to move on!
^I shuffle Timothy off to another part of the building to continue the tour.

c: ^I instinctively correct Timothy on Max's pronouns out of habit.
^As Timothy begins to retreat inward I quickly add...
^I decide not to correct Timothy, mostly because I don't want to set him off.
^Unfortunately, Timothy freezes up anyway, seemingly realizing the mistake on his own.

g-0: ^"Don't worry if you make an honest mistake like that. Max'll understand."
^Timothy looks at me as if I've read his mind.
^Honestly, I'm pretty sure Max'd be more worried as to why Timothy is having a near breakdown over this mistake than the fact they got mis-gendered.
^"Timothy, I don't really know what kind of life you've had up 'til now, but you're safe here."
^He asks as if he genuinely hasn't considered that before. @I chuckle again.
^Max being genuinely angry at someone seems about as realistic as an M.C. Escher painting.
^] "People don't get mad at slight slips of the tongue. They get made at being disrespected and invalidated."
^"Words can be used to do that, but it's the intent that really matters. You, Timothy, are fine."
^I try to word it as confidently as possible to assuage Timothy's fears. I don't know if I succeeded.
^] "Hey, don't worry about it. You're here to heal remember? You've got nothing to apologize for."

Calming: ^Leaving that awkward conversation behind us, it's time to move on!
^I shuffle Timothy off to another part of the building to continue the tour.

NonBinaryBonus: ^Timothy starts shaking, looking away from me in embarrassment, before giving me a wobbly thumbs up.
^"<jitter>A-and I-I'm s-sorry if I sc-screw up, and pl-please correct me if I do.</jitter>"
^It's reaching peak awkwardness now, but it's kinda sweet and I appreciate the gesture, as unnecessary as it is.
^It does relax me a little, so that's nice. @Stress decreased slightly!
